abstract: Remembering how exciting it was to be a race fan at the commencement of an event that would forever alter the landscape of thoroughbred horse racing.
snippet: Remembering how exciting it was to be a race fan at the commencement of an event that would forever alter the landscape of thoroughbred horse racing.
lead_paragraph: I was at Hollywood Park on Nov. 10, 1984, for the inaugural running of the Breeders' Cup. My dad and I had been going to races in Southern California for just over a decade by that time, and we rarely missed a feature race on a weekend at any of the area's major tracks, so there was no way we were missing the first Breeders' Cup.

headline.main: Breeders' Cup Memories, From the First Break Out of the Gate
